title: Ping has been @ 71ms, when it was 36ms two months ago.

embed.description: So, I went out of town on February 24th, and my ping was a awesome 36 constantly, I come back in town on February 28th and my ping is not a constant 77, like it literally won't get lower than that.

body:
I posted this on another thread about two months ago when there was some unexpected login issues following a maintenance (which was ironically for routing). Ever since, my ping has been almost double and there isn't really a reason for it. Could I get some insight into why?

Thanks.

replies.body: Your ISP's routing may have changed to take the scenic road, making it longer for your connection to reach our servers.  I recommend running a [traceroute ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)to get an overview of your network to our servers. [ Submit a ticket ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)to our tech team with the log attached, and we can take a look at what's going on.

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=lzbOA0dF,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-07-16T20:53:28.962+0000)
>
> Your ISP's routing may have changed to take the scenic road, making it longer for your connection to reach our servers.  I recommend running a [traceroute ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)to get an overview of your network to our servers. [ Submit a ticket ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)to our tech team with the log attached, and we can take a look at what's going on.

I posted my traceroutes on the tech support subreddit and they said the problem was with Riot, and not my ISP.

Are you with Rogers Canada?

EDIT: nevermind, ur not
